"The more frequent and intense coastal flooding brought on by sea level rise will impact all Americans. Along our coasts are assets worth trillions of dollars." -Dr. @radleyhorton

"As the temperatures of coastal waters rise, harmful algal blooms are more likely to occur. These blooms produce marine biotoxins that are poisons. Shellfish ingest the biotoxins...causing illness in humans who consume the infected shellfish."-Ms. Margaret Pilaro

“…sea level rise is also a public health and safety issue. It means less time to evacuate from low lying areas in advance of a coastal storm, and greater risk of injury and death for those vulnerable members of our communities who are unable to evacuate.”- Dr. @radleyhorton

"Unfortunately, our ocean and the people who depend on it are facing unprecedented challenges. The ocean is a system at risk, struggling to keep pace with rising temperatures, pollution, and the absorption of greenhouse gases." - Dr. Sarah @co2ley

"ARPA-E has been an excellent source of early stage funding for audacious and ambitious new energy technologies. The majority of the successful companies and projects discussed here would simply not exist if it were not for the early stage funding of ARPA-E." - Dr. Saul Griffith
“ARPA-E plays a unique and vital role in US energy innovation, beyond what industry can do for itself.” -  Dr. John Wall

"ARPA-E recognizes the economic, environmental, and energy security importance to the United States of technological innovation in the face of the world’s evolving energy systems. I would like the US to remain a leader, and based our capabilities, we should." - Dr. Ellen Williams

"It is very important for Congress to be patient in its expectations of commercial impact from ARPA-E... Expectations of short-term success will produce incremental thinking from ARPA-E, & that will defeat the whole purpose...which should be going for the homeruns."-Dr. Majumdar

Director of Climate Policy at @NiskanenCenter, @JosephMajkut: "As climate change continues, more severe and pervasive effects will reveal themselves, causing damages to individuals, ecosystems, and economic harm."

.@UW Professor of Public Health Sciences, Dr. Kristie L. Ebi: "Climate change is affecting the health of Americans today and will affect our health and our public health and healthcare infrastructure in the future. This is an issue of critical national importance."
#ClimateAction

"Images of floods caused by feet of rain unleashed by hurricanes Harvey and Florence, docks sitting on dry soil in California’s reservoirs, a sunken New Jersey roller coaster in the wake of Superstorm Sandy – to name only a very few – are forever etched in our memories." (2/2)
Dr. Jennifer Francis of @WoodsHoleResCtr: "It's not your imagination: extreme weather events have become more frequent in recent decades."  (1/2)

Dr. Natalie M. Mahowald of @Cornell: "For many years, the scientific consensus on climate change has been clear, with over 97% of climate scientists agreeing that human-caused climate change is a problem we need to address."
#ClimateAction

This past year we learned from numerous reports that #climateaction is necessary now more than ever. We must work to mitigate and solve this growing threat.

A warming climate presents serious challenges for U.S. national security interests. Our economy, safety, and security are all affected by the scientific reality of climate change. #SOTU
Natural disasters caused by extreme weather are damaging American  industry. It is beneficial for everyone if we #ActOnClimate #SOTU
Not once did the President mention perhaps the biggest challenge of our time: climate change. #SOTU

Sustained funding for our agencies and prioritized investments in the R&D that drives our economy, keeps our nation competitive, protects the environment and public health, contributes to the nation's prosperity, and "American greatness." #SOTU
We cannot afford another #TrumpShutdown. The 35 day shutdown not only hurt our national economy but it has inflicted long-term damage on our nation’s research and development enterprise. #SOTU
The U.S. should be supporting robust investments across the energy technology spectrum that will make the U.S. more competitive and create well-paying jobs for Americans across the country. #SOTU

All February long, we celebrate the countless contributions African-Americans have made to our nation. We especially like to recognize the African-Americans who have played a pivotal role in advancing our country’s scientific enterprise. #BlackHistoryMonth
